meta.description: Korean Air KAL Lounge at Los Angeles International Airport (LAX), International Terminal. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Korean Air KAL Lounge

location.terminalDirections: After security, take the elevators to the entrance at the south end of Level 5.

location.description: QLA, Los Angeles, California, United States

lounge.description: The 1,320-square-meter KAL lounge contains 305 seats, four private lounge rooms, shower facilities, and a balcony that overlooks the terminal below. The entrance to the lounge features artwork depicting the Changdeok Palace in Seoul, which has been named an UNESCO World Heritage site.

general: Children under 2 years are admitted free with an adult. All children must be accompanied by an adult.

reviews.content: Got some time? Worth the visit. Spent a few hours here, friendly service, decent food and self-serve well bar. No idea what previous comments were about; place was clean and spacious.
Lounge is best one accessible to Priority Pass holders. Food is decent. Lots of space to sit and work. Don’t know why people are complaining about it.
I would truly prefer to sit in the terminal. This lounge was dirty, the food was extremely limited and the beverages choices were slim. The highlight of it is certainly the view from the deck.
Food was embarrassingly bad. Seating upholstery was filthy. At least there was no music being piped in.
Very poor selection of food, even missing food. Beverages was OK, and mild clean, restroom was good and clean.
Worn, crowded and embarrassingly poor food.  Slow WiFi.
Amazing lounge if you can get in. They open at 1pm for PP. Great food, loved the egg fried rice. Decent alcohol collection, JD, Bombay Sapphire and some win and beers. Good WiFi and ample seating.
PP OK Monday @ 5:30pm. Alcohol/food well stocked; tables were clean. Food: hot wings, fried rice, sandwiches, sushi rolls, soup, noodles, cereal, muffins, fruit, etc. Not a premier lounge, but good!
It’s big but crowded with dated uncomfortable seating with gross food and poor beverage choices. Just marginally better than the terminal.
Small crowded lounge with mediocre food options (small sandwiches, pizza slices, cut fruit etc).  Same for beverage choices, biggest draw is instant noodle cup.
This lounge needs a cleaning, I mean deep down scrub.  I don't see anything wrong with the furniture, just the cleanliness of it.
Closed at 6PM - the counter hostesses were quite rude when I walked up...
Rudest lady on the front desk. Learn some social skills!
The front desk lady was uninterested and rude. She wasn’t willing to answer any question, very poor experience.
It wasn’t crowded on a Thurs night. I came here to shower up before my 15 hr flight. The shower was clean and had everything I needed. I’ll keep coming here until the Centurion opens up at LAX.
Always extremely crowded. Lots of the seats are very worn, food options don’t look great. Free wine and drinks are good. It’s a better option than sitting in the terminal I suppose.
Quiet, chill lounge with a good amount of options — was here from 7-8 pm on a Tues night, and they had pizza, sushi, and chicken wings, also soup and a ton of bev options.
Average food options, spacious but dingy carpets and lounge chairs.
Great variety of food. Pizza, fried rice, chicken pieces, sandwiches, sushi, soup, Fruit, cake and cereal. Help yourself to wine, beer, soft drinks. Shower rooms brilliant. Toothbrushes available.
No plates left and only rice as hot food. No champagne or sparkling wine and only 3 wine. choices. Overall very disappointing, balcony is the only vaguely redeeming feature.
Average lounge. Non so great choice of food but ok. Comfortable seats. Drinks are OK.
One of the biggest lounges I have been to. Easily seats about 250 people. Nice balcony that over looks the terminal shopping area. Mostly finger food like sandwiches, and instant noodles.

This one is about as basic as it gets. Bathroom is clean enough which is nice. Fairly crowded on a slow day in the terminal. Used plates and napkins everywhere. Food & drink selection is VERY limited.
Dirty chairs & ripped carpets, gum on chairs, very limited food, self service bar: NO cocktails. No place to stretch out during a long layover. Worst club room, apart from one in Borneo! A disgrace.
Good snacks.  Nice service. Clean bathroom. Internet is ok. Sushis are also okay. Not crowded and you can lay down on the benches too.
Love the airy space and terrace. F&B is really limited, but enough to tidy you over (finger foods, cup noodles, chips/salsa). Wifi is decent. Entered w/ PP, no issues.
Food choice is mediocre, drinks are only slightly better. It is not of the level expected from Air France or KLM or KAL!!
Lower end of international lounges. Often crowded. Typical selection of food- finger sandwiches, maki sushi & small self-serve bar. Several bathroom stalls & the showers were out of order.
Walked all the way across the airport to get here at 8am only to find they mysteriously stay closed until after 9am. Sweaty hot and very disappointed. Other lounges are open.
Tons of outlets and seating. It's all relatively comfortable. The food is mostly finger food - small sandwiches and fruit etc. No complaints!
Nice furnishings and ambience. Mediocre food and quite crowded. Accessible from Terminal 4.
They wouldn't let me in. No Priority Pass members allowed, because it was too full.
Showers are clean, power outlets everywhere. A mix of comfy seats, the most drab looking are the most comfortable.  At least 3 benches without overhead lights to take a nap. No private rooms.
A nice large lounge overlooking the peasants. Extremely limited food selection for so many airlines using the lounge. Small finger sandwiches and pretzels. Lots of electrical outlets. Good views.
Decent basic lounge, but getting dirty...Someone needs to reupholster all these chairs. Super fast wifi is nice.
Nice and clean lounge with decent amenities and comfort. Hot food options are very disappointing. Service is just above average.
A little long in the tooth and basic, but pleasant.
The beige chairs are looking a bit dated in the front lounge, but the remaining sections and patio are both in very good condition and make it more than worthwhile. Decent food selections.
Showers are really nice. Food is ok... instant noodles, cold sandwiches. Selection of drinks is pretty good.

Good if you're in terminal 4 or Tom Bradley international terminal. It's a short walk from terminal 4. They had cupcakes, pretzels, chips, a few sandwiches, noodle soup, sofa cans, juices, coffee machine.
The once beige chairs are so filthy that they're black. The food is nonexistent, worst lounge food we've had anywhere truly. Sad for LAX.
Nice views of the terminal, decent atmosphere, bar was self serve and wine list was non-existent.
No Westpac affiliated access. Lies.
Below average lounge. The lounge performs very poorly when compared to the other options at LAX. Some finger food and packaged noodles. Full bar. Great seating area overlooking terminal. Poor wifi.
Great lounge with a nice selection of snacks. Comfortable seating and many charging ports. Will use again.
Bad food. Comfy chairs. Sterile feeling.
✅ quiet, clean, comfortable with nice views over airport concourse below. Great roomy showers. ❌limited food options, many of the saggy chairs need replacing/updating.
Very comfortable but poor food choices.
Comfortable, decent drinks, could have better appetizers/food.

Light and airy, the lounge has views of the plaza below and an interesting terrace. Limited food and beverage offerings although this may be related to the KAL flight timings. It was very quiet at 930a.
The food selection is very poor.
OK lounge, many seats, food is OK, just sandwich and fruits, no bottled water.

A great place to retreat and relax. Love the balcony overlooking the terminal. Food was nothing too exciting but more substantial than domestic lounges. Worth a visit if you've got a few hours at LAX.
Food and beverage options are just about the worst that I've ever seen in an international lounge.
No real food options besides some little snacks. Huge, ample room, quite and comfortable.
Poor food selection, location is ok but I have been to better lounges. I wouldn't recommend this to other passengers traveling out of LAX.
Nice lounge. Not enough outlets in the seating areas, but great service. Self serve bar was nicely stocked, too.
It works- definitely better then the average domestic lounge but not by much. :)
Food is slightly better than a US domestic lounge: cold sandwiches, fresh fruit and vegetables, chips and salsa, instant noodles, and muffins. Self serve bar with liquor and wine.
Had to wait 10 min at 12:30 on a Monday to get in. Check in agents were overwhelmed, but the cleaning staff was super nice. Luggage lockers are available and there are 3 shower suits. Key is needed.
A barn of a lounge that was packed to the gills when I was there. Lots of broken plugs throughout made finding a place to charge a challenge, but I still found plenty of food and drink pre-flight!
Reasonable lounge. Comfortable seating, plenty of power plugs. Sandwiches, chips and salsa, fruit, instant noodles available. Self serve bar with limited liquor choice.
Sad sad sad. The pathetic lack of quality snacks or cocktails cements SkyTeam's third rate reputation.
Not a bad lounge. Food selection is pretty poor. Same with the alcohol. But it is a nice place to escape the crowds.
No veg food for veggies, that is a first for me!!!!!! All meat no veg sandwiches, guess what - we had peppers to EAT!!!!!!!!
Clean and comfortable. Very limited food selection, think finger sandwiches and cup of noodles (albeit good cup of noodles). Self serve bar with average booze, limited beer selection.
I was not allowed to use the lounge despite being a Delta Sky Club member and a platinum level frequent flyer. I was told this was because I was flying on Turkish Air which is not a SkyTeam airline.
Big lounge with plenty of seating. Light food including small sandwiches, fruit, chips/salsa, chocolate chip muffins. Self serve open bar with beer (Cass or Budweiser) and a few different liquors.
Three showers available, and plenty of seating with power ports galore! Snacks and drinks are also available.
This large lounge has clean bathrooms, and offers a variety of foods: sandwiches, chips and salsa, fruits and vegetables. However, this is a bit far from the boarding area.
Small food selection, but there's a variety of instant ramen. In addition, there's a self-serve bar and open fridge of soda. Though it's a nice lounge, it's lacking compared to other intl lounges.
When I was here waiting for a red-eye flight, there were only a few people. The WiFi was fast enough to load Netflix videos, and the amenities were good.
This is your typical US domest airport lounge. Though it's comfortable enough, it's not noteworthy at all.
Despite this lounge being clean and better than the terminal, it's quite lackluster, with its oft-crowdedness and pathetic food selection.
Nice, clean, and quiet lounge with 2 showers and self-serve drinks. However, the food is quite limited in this lounge.
This lounge offers nice snacks, including little sandwiches that I really enjoyed.
Light lunch and self-serve bar available. Very busy in the afternoon. Poor WiFi speeds. Sprint/Verizon have horrible voice/data coverage. Quiet place in the INTL terminal.
This lounge has a very European feel, and offers nice snacks and light meal service. Plenty of seating, LED TVs, and cool mood lighting can also be found here.
